direction.raw_text: . FUNERAL HOME. ELIOT'S ROOM - EARLY MORNING Darkness.   A bright light comes on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON a MAN'S HANDS. Turning slowly under a stream of crystal blue water. We pull back. Eliot dries his hands. Opens a cabinet. Takes out a pair of latex gloves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FUNERAL HOME. PREP ROOM - EARLY MORNING A large room. Tall vaulted ceilings. White tiles. Soft morning light seeps in from a small round window set high on one wall. The room is silent. Still. Like a chapel. In the semi-darkness we see a BODY on a porcelain slab covered with a white sheet. We hear a key turn in a lock. Then another lock.       The room's suddenly flooded with a harsh white light. Eliot steps inside the room. He takes off his jacket. Carefully places it on a coat-hanger. Puts on a pale blue smock then snaps on the latex gloves. His every move meticulous. Measured. Like a ritual. Eliot walks over to the slab, his surgery clogs softly clacking against the tiled floor. He looks at the slab for a moment then slowly pulls the sheet away revealing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Pale and lifeless. An ugly gash above her eyebrow. Cracked violet lips. A rip in her black dress soaked with a dark stain. She's only wearing one shoe. Eliot gently takes off the watch from her stiff wrist. Places it inside a brown paper bag. Eases off the shoe. Picks up a scalpel from a tray of instruments on a steel trolley. Delicately slices open her dress. Peels it off. He's about to cut the straps of her RED SLIP when... Anna OPENS HER EYES. She looks straight at us with unseeing pale blue eyes. Strangely Eliot's not surprised.   He calmly steps back. Watches her carefully. Anna's eyes slowly focus on Eliot.     She's groggy.   Confused.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ANNA Where am I? She talks with difficulty.       Her breathe labored. ELIOT You're in a funeral home. (BEAT) You're dead. Anna's vacant eyes widen in shock. She struggles to sit up but she can't even raise her head. Her body stiff. Rigid. Eliot speaks to her calmly. Soothingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks fearfully at the bloodied dress in Eliot's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eliot looks at her sadly for a moment. He places the bloodied dress on the trolley. Then picks up a document. Holds it up for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Anna's death certificate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anna stares with horror at her death certificate, then at Eliot. He looks away. It pains him to see her so distressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eliot picks up a sponge from the trolley.   Wets it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eliot delicately washes Anna's face. She doesn't flinch as he dabs the wound above her eye brow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eliot sighs wearily.   As if he'd had this conversation many times before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eliot peels off his latex gloves and heads for the door. As he hangs his pale blue smock on the peg he turns and looks at Anna for a moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The lights go off. O.S. the door clicks shut as it locks automatically behind Eliot.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

Desperately searching for her pulse. Then frantically checks her neck. Panicking. She can't find her heartbeat. She stares at her hand. Then abruptly SLAMS it against the slab. Hard. She feels no pain. She does it again. Harder. Still nothing.

direction.raw_text: . BEDROOM - NIGHT Jack lies in bed staring at the ceiling. On his bedside table an alarm clock reads 2.38AM. He looks across at an Anglepoise lamp in the corner of the room bent over an open shoebox. He gets up. Walks towards the muted light. The SMALL CHICK huddles in the shoebox. Not quite sure why he came into the room in the first place. He moves over to a CD player. Mechanically switches it on. Music fills the room. He turns the volume higher. Then all the way up. The music's unbearably loud but Paul just stands there. Numb.

direction.raw_text: The music's strangely distorted now.        Almost silent.   As if we were inside Paul's head.

direction.raw_text: . FUNERAL HOME. PREP ROOM - NIGHT Anna lies on the slab. Curled in a fetal position. O.S. we hear the UNNATURALLY LOUD metallic drip of a faulty faucet. Slow. Rhythmical. Anna opens her eyes. Stares at us. Terrified. Then she turns her head. The Old Woman sits on the other slab. Slowly brushing her tangled gray hair with a silver backed brush. Anna looks around anxiously. The room is strangely larger. The perspective not quite right. Certain objects look absurdly small or abnormally large. She notices a TINY DOOR. Half hidden by a steel trolley. The door's slightly ajar. Anna's surprised. The Old Woman shakes her head. Staring blindly at Anna with opaque eyes. Anna ignores her. Moves quickly to the tiny door. As she approaches, the door seems to grow to normal size. Then we realize it's Anna who has shrunk. The steel trolley now towers high above her. The massive instruments on the trolley look like menacing insects cast in surgical steel. She opens the door. Revealing a solid wall of DARKNESS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the small shape of Anna in the doorway. The huge dark space engulfs her. The only light comes from the Prep Room behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anna reaches forward. Her hand disappears into the thick blackness. She snatches her hand back. Scared. Then... ...a CHILD'S HAND darts out of the darkness. Grabs Anna's wrist. Pulling her in with surprising strength. Anna struggles to free herself. But the hand drags her deeper into the darkness. The door slams shut behind her.

dialogue.raw_text: Anna!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Through the windshield we see Paul approach the car. He peers in nervously. Then cautiously gets in. As he switches the interior light off, the camera moves slowly around him revealing... ... ANNA sitting in the passenger seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul turns sharply.    Stunned.   Anna moves towards him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anna puts her fingers on Paul's lips. Clearly turned on. We hear the sound of something being UNZIPPED.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A line of BLOOD trickles from his nose. He touches his lips. Looks blankly at the blood on his fingertips. A drop of blood falls on Paul's white shirt. It unfurls like a flower. Spreading out over the material.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anna hungrily kisses him. He responds passionately. Suddenly we hear a SHARP METALLIC SOUND.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anna responds as if it was nothing strange.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see the growing anxiety in Paul's eyes.    Anna's just interested in his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul pulls back.   Terrified.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A strong bright light sweeps across Paul's face. Like the headlights of the car on the blind curve earlier.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul blinks as he gradually gets used to the harsh light. Slowly the room comes into focus...
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Are we going home?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Or do you want to make love here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where did you go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've been waiting for you.    I missed you so much.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I love you.   I always did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What was that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's only the scissors...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Scissors?   What scissors?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Scissors. For your clothes.    Eliot just put them on the table.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're safe now. We're finally together.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . FUNERAL HOME. PREP ROOM - NIGHT Eliot stands over Paul holding a pair of BLOODY SCISSORS. Paul looks down. His white shirt soaked with blood, the material sliced open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . He talks with difficulty.   His breath labored.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jack appears at Eliot's side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Paul's glazed eyes widen in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eliot speaks calmly.    Soothingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eliot sighs wearily.    He's had this conversation many times before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eliot's voice, with each word, fades further and further away. Paul closes his eyes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where am I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're in a funeral home. (BEAT) You're dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You had a car accident. You swerved off the road. On the way to the cemetery. Hit a tree.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I saw Anna.    You buried her alive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry Mr. Conran. You never made it to the cemetery. You never saw Anna. You're dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your skull was crushed. Your spinal cord pulverized. Your brain cells are slowly dying. Your body's already decomposing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You people.    You all say the same thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) I'm not dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue
